Package com.stuypulse.frc.robot.commands

Class DrivetrainAlignCommand

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.CommandBase
      • com.stuypulse.frc.robot.commands.DrivetrainCommand
        • com.stuypulse.frc.robot.commands.DrivetrainAlignCommand
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Sendable, edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.Command
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DrivetrainGoalCommand, DrivetrainMoveCommand
    public abstract class DrivetrainAlignCommand
extends DrivetrainCommand
    Command in which rather than defining the direction of the robot, errors are defined and a controller is used to get the drivetrain to that point.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize()

        Everytime this command is called, initialize will be run. Target angle and speed are the setpoints that will be determined when the command is started by taking the getError functions and adding it to the drivetrain's current speed and angle.

        ...

      • getGear

        public GearController.Gear getGear()
        Description copied from class: DrivetrainCommand

        In order to stay consistent, all drivetrain commands must give a gear.

        This replaces using auto gear in Drivetrain.periodic(). With this, it is still possible to use automatic gear shifting when it can be applied (e.g. drive with gamepad).
        Specified by:
        getGear in class DrivetrainCommand
        Returns:
        gear of the drivetrain
